title: Same Same But Different: Let’s Hit the Slopes, Shall We?
text: Welcome to Same Same But Different. As Gen Z and millennial fashion commerce editors, respectively, we know a thing or two about shopping—for all ages, and especially our demographics. As we find the best products for you, we can’t help but do a little shopping for ourselves and build our personal (age-appropriate) wish lists. And now, we’re sharing them with you. Ahead, check out what’s in our hearts and in our carts lately.Dale Chong: Feeling refreshed after that holiday break? I know I am. And with a new year upon us, I’m feeling pretty pumped for what’s to come in 2025. First up: ski trips. While I know not everyone is a skier or a snowboarder, there’s nothing quite like sipping on a hot chocolate (or better yet, a hot toddy) up in the mountains, right?We’re in peak season, after all.Meg Donohue: Admittedly I’m not a skier, but I am here for the vibes (as always). My packing list would undoubtedly include these Gucci goggles, which are honestly iconic, and my red SuperPuff. I wore it last year for a snowmobiling excursion in Vail, and it was perfect.Gucci Gucci Ski GogglesThe Super Puff Puff2O Shorty Arc'teryx Rho HoodyGoldbergh Phoebe Ski PantsHunter for FP Season Pass Boots DC: I certainly have some thoughts. Over the years, I’ve come to embrace practical pieces like Arc'teryx’s bib and Burton’s snowboard. Of course, I am a fashion girl to my core, and this year I’ll be adding a Goldbergh jacket (the brand was seen in the latest season of Emily in Paris—can you believe?!) and Moon boots for when I make it to the bottom of the mountain. But you have to have some handy staples in the mix, don’t you?MD: Yeah, my world was rocked when I found this base layer. It has a hood that goes all the way around (like a ski mask) to keep your face warm. But the kicker is that it has a hole in the back for a ponytail. Innovation!Goldbergh Soleil Goose Down Puffer Arc'teryx Sentinel Bib Pant Burton Hideaway Flat Top Snowboard Moon Boot Icon Low Glance Noah Logo Knit BeanieDC: That is impressive. And honestly, something I would have never thought about.MD: Let’s move on to the good stuff: après-ski. Cozy fireplaces, belly-warming drinks, and fondue? That has my name written all over it. I’m ready to hunker down with a deck of cards and hit the spiked cider. Be honest, do you prefer the snow part or the après part? There’s no wrong answer.DC: I have to admit it: I love spending an hour or two in the hot tub after a day on the slopes.MD: How could I forget the HOT TUBS? Aisling Camps Blanket Stitch Knit BoleroNoname Is Needed Dotty BoyshortsUgg Classic Ultra Mini Platform Boot Moose Knuckles Agate Shearling Down Puffer Jacket Now 25% Off& Daughter Fionn Cashmere FoulardDC: But when I’m not doing that, you’ll probably find me cozying up in really good knitwear. I have fallen in love with this Aisling Camps bolero, which feels like an undeniably sophisticated take on the après lifestyle. I’ll pair that with these adorable little shorts that add a playful touch to the ensemble—which will be finished up with these incredible Ugg boots. When I need to leave the resort, I’ll be throwing on this fluffy Moose Knuckles layer and a scarf (and probably some pants, while I’m at it). As long as I’m in cozy, warm knits, I’m happy.MD: That is true; you are such a knit chick. I’m opting for a fleece because I want all the warmth I can get. If there’s one thing I must have, it’s my favorite pair of socks. I know it sounds underwhelming, but they’re so thick and divine. Like a hug for my feet! Also, I can’t get over these Parajumpers mittens. I don’t care if mittens are less practical than gloves; look at how cute they are. I’ll be able to hold a mug and dip a Bavarian pretzel into beer cheese, so I don’t need much else.Loro Piana Cashmere Felt Hat with Fur CuffNow 57% OffIsabel Marant Étoile Mackensys Sherpa BomberLeset Pointelle Boxer Pant Parajumpers Shearling Mittens Bombas Merino Wool Blend Roll-Top Gripper House Socks
html:
Welcome to Same Same But Different. As Gen Z and millennial fashion commerce editors, respectively, we know a thing or two about shopping—for all ages, and especially our demographics. As we find the best products for you, we can’t help but do a little shopping for ourselves and build our personal (age-appropriate) wish lists. And now, we’re sharing them with you. Ahead, check out what’s in our hearts and in our carts lately.

Dale Chong: Feeling refreshed after that holiday break? I know I am. And with a new year upon us, I’m feeling pretty pumped for what’s to come in 2025. First up: ski trips. While I know not everyone is a skier or a snowboarder, there’s nothing quite like sipping on a hot chocolate (or better yet, a hot toddy) up in the mountains, right?

We’re in peak season, after all.

Meg Donohue: Admittedly I’m not a skier, but I am here for the vibes (as always). My packing list would undoubtedly include these Gucci goggles, which are honestly iconic, and my red SuperPuff. I wore it last year for a snowmobiling excursion in Vail, and it was perfect.

Gucci Gucci Ski Goggles

The Super Puff Puff2O Shorty

Arc'teryx Rho Hoody

Goldbergh Phoebe Ski Pants

Hunter for FP Season Pass Boots

DC: I certainly have some thoughts. Over the years, I’ve come to embrace practical pieces like Arc'teryx’s bib and Burton’s snowboard. Of course, I am a fashion girl to my core, and this year I’ll be adding a Goldbergh jacket (the brand was seen in the latest season of Emily in Paris—can you believe?!) and Moon boots for when I make it to the bottom of the mountain. But you have to have some handy staples in the mix, don’t you?

MD: Yeah, my world was rocked when I found this base layer. It has a hood that goes all the way around (like a ski mask) to keep your face warm. But the kicker is that it has a hole in the back for a ponytail. Innovation!

Goldbergh Soleil Goose Down Puffer

Arc'teryx Sentinel Bib Pant

Burton Hideaway Flat Top Snowboard

Moon Boot Icon Low Glance

Noah Logo Knit Beanie

DC: That is impressive. And honestly, something I would have never thought about.

MD: Let’s move on to the good stuff: après-ski. Cozy fireplaces, belly-warming drinks, and fondue? That has my name written all over it. I’m ready to hunker down with a deck of cards and hit the spiked cider. Be honest, do you prefer the snow part or the après part? There’s no wrong answer.

DC: I have to admit it: I love spending an hour or two in the hot tub after a day on the slopes.

MD: How could I forget the HOT TUBS?

Aisling Camps Blanket Stitch Knit Bolero

Noname Is Needed Dotty Boyshorts

Ugg Classic Ultra Mini Platform Boot

Moose Knuckles Agate Shearling Down Puffer Jacket

Now 25% Off

& Daughter Fionn Cashmere Foulard

DC: But when I’m not doing that, you’ll probably find me cozying up in really good knitwear. I have fallen in love with this Aisling Camps bolero, which feels like an undeniably sophisticated take on the après lifestyle. I’ll pair that with these adorable little shorts that add a playful touch to the ensemble—which will be finished up with these incredible Ugg boots. When I need to leave the resort, I’ll be throwing on this fluffy Moose Knuckles layer and a scarf (and probably some pants, while I’m at it). As long as I’m in cozy, warm knits, I’m happy.

MD: That is true; you are such a knit chick. I’m opting for a fleece because I want all the warmth I can get. If there’s one thing I must have, it’s my favorite pair of socks. I know it sounds underwhelming, but they’re so thick and divine. Like a hug for my feet! Also, I can’t get over these Parajumpers mittens. I don’t care if mittens are less practical than gloves; look at how cute they are. I’ll be able to hold a mug and dip a Bavarian pretzel into beer cheese, so I don’t need much else.

Loro Piana Cashmere Felt Hat with Fur Cuff

Now 57% Off

Isabel Marant Étoile Mackensys Sherpa Bomber

Leset Pointelle Boxer Pant

Parajumpers Shearling Mittens

Bombas Merino Wool Blend Roll-Top Gripper House Socks
